intro: Bardotia ankaranensis, commonly known as the Ankaranensis Bardotia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
